skill.name: brainstorming
skill.description: Use when creating or developing anything, before writing code or implementation plans - refines rough ideas into fully-formed designs through structured Socratic questioning, alternative exploration, and incremental validation
skill.summary: Use when creating or developing anything, before writing code or implementation plans - refines roug...
skill.author: DYAI2025

security_audit.summary: This is a documentation-only skill with no executable code. It provides a structured process for brainstorming and design validation using only the AskUserQuestion tool for user interaction. No security risks detected.

content.value_statement: Turn rough concepts into complete designs through systematic questioning and validation. This skill guides you from initial idea to validated implementation plan using proven design thinking techniques.
actual_capabilities: Guides 5-phase design process from understanding to implementation planning
Uses structured questions to clarify requirements and constraints
Presents multiple architectural approaches with trade-off analysis
Validates design incrementally through section-by-section review
Integrates with git worktrees for isolated development environments
Creates detailed implementation plans using writing-plans skill
limitations: Requires active user participation throughout the process
Design quality depends on user's domain knowledge and feedback
Process may take 15-30 minutes for complex features
Cannot generate code directly - only creates implementation plans

use_cases.title: Design new API architecture
use_cases.description: Transform vague API requirements into a complete architecture with authentication, rate limiting, and error handling strategies.

use_cases.title: Plan feature implementation
use_cases.description: Convert feature ideas into technical specifications with user stories, acceptance criteria, and implementation roadmap.

use_cases.title: Design MVP architecture
use_cases.description: Refine startup ideas into scalable technical architecture balancing speed, cost, and future growth needs.

prompt_templates.title: New Feature Design
prompt_templates.prompt: I need to add user authentication to my web app. Users should be able to register, login, and reset passwords. The app will have free and premium tiers. Help me design the authentication system architecture.

prompt_templates.title: API Architecture
prompt_templates.prompt: I want to build a REST API for a task management app. Users can create projects, add tasks, and collaborate with team members. I need rate limiting and caching. What's the best architecture approach?

prompt_templates.title: Database Design
prompt_templates.prompt: I'm building an e-commerce platform with products, orders, inventory, and customer management. Help me design the database schema and data flow between services.

prompt_templates.title: System Integration
prompt_templates.prompt: I need to design a microservices architecture for a logistics platform with order tracking, driver management, and real-time notifications. How should I structure the services and communication?

output_examples.input: I want to add a recommendation engine to my content platform
output: Phase 1 - Understanding complete: Content types, user behavior tracking needs, performance requirements identified
Phase 2 - 3 approaches evaluated: Collaborative filtering vs content-based vs hybrid approach
Phase 3 - Design validated: Real-time scoring service with Redis caching, batch training pipeline, A/B testing framework
Phase 4 - Worktree ready: Isolated development environment configured for safe experimentation
Phase 5 - Implementation plan: 12 tasks including data pipeline setup, ML model training, API endpoints, and monitoring

best_practices: Be specific about constraints, requirements, and success criteria to get better design recommendations
Ask clarifying questions when options aren't clear - the skill is designed for iterative refinement
Validate each design section before proceeding to catch issues early in the process
anti_patterns: Don't skip the understanding phase - rushing leads to designs that miss critical requirements
Avoid accepting the first design without exploring alternatives - always review 2-3 approaches
Don't ignore the validation checkpoints - they're essential for catching design flaws before implementation

faq.question: Is this skill compatible with all AI coding assistants?
faq.answer: Yes, it works with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code. The process is tool-agnostic and focuses on design thinking principles.

faq.question: How long does the full brainstorming process take?
faq.answer: Typically 15-30 minutes depending on feature complexity. Complex systems may require multiple sessions.

faq.question: Can I integrate this with my existing project management tools?
faq.answer: The skill creates implementation plans that can be exported to any project management system. It doesn't integrate directly but outputs standard task formats.

faq.question: Is my idea data safe during brainstorming?
faq.answer: Yes, no data leaves your session. The skill only asks questions and presents options - it doesn't store or transmit your ideas anywhere.

faq.question: What if I disagree with the recommended approach?
faq.answer: The skill presents multiple approaches with trade-offs. You can always go back to explore alternatives or modify the design based on your expertise.

faq.question: How does this compare to other design tools?
faq.answer: Unlike static templates, this skill adapts to your specific context through interactive questioning and validates designs incrementally with your feedback.
